message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV. 

The paper is about text generation using Generative Adversarial Nets (GAN) and policy gradient, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a new framework that incorporates leaked information to improve the guidance of the generative model, which involves reinforcement learning and optimization techniques, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper mentions the applications of text generation in dialogue systems and image captioning, which are related to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.CV (Computer Vision), respectively. Finally, the paper uses synthetic data and Turing test to evaluate the proposed framework, which involves simulation and testing, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) a possible sub-category as well.
